intro: Veronica austriaca subsp. scheereri, commonly known as the Alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. It is often found in mountain meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
